issue.title: Probable misuse of term "function scope" in [thread.condition]

discussion.p: All usages of "function scope" in and , such as p10 b4:

blockquote.p: If the function exits via an exception, lock.lock() shall be called prior to exiting the function scope.

discussion.p: seem to be inappropriate compared to the actual core language definition of :

blockquote.p: Labels (6.1) have function scope and may be used anywhere in the function in which they are declared. Only labels have function scope.

discussion.p: Probably the intended meaning is "outermost block scope of the function".
